> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On 

> What is=
 a partial failure?

Your setUp() method fails halfway, so only half of the=
 resources need to be
freed.

> The set up belongs to the test. I think it =
is reasonable to 
> say the test fails if its setup fails.

No, it's not th=
e tests that are failing, it's the setUp.

Imagine you have 100 tests and 1=
 set up.  The setUp fails, and now JUnit is
telling you you have "101 FAILU=
RES"...  Very helpful!  And QA will freak out
on you.  And I'm sure you alr=
eady know you can't "trust" this report and
that you are actually looking a=
t a cascade failure.

Compare this to "1 FAILURE, 100 SKIPS".

Now, *that* =
is a much more acurate view of what really happened.
